title: i have an obsession with my dad and i dont know how to stop it

Then i began to feel intense feelings towards him and now im like i need to be near him constantly. i try to distract myself but it always comes back. I've tried therapy but it hasn’t helped. I don't want to be this way anymore. Is there anything i can do?

I feel betrayed and also kind of impressed.  I don’t know what to do with this information. I want answers! Why didn't he tell me? What did he do? Was I even aware that I was his daughter? This is insane.

title: I thought I was the only one who had a problem with my dad being obsessed with me.
self_text: My dad is obsessed with me and it's driving me insane. He always wants to know where I am, what I'm doing, who I'm with, etc. It makes me feel like I have no privacy or freedom. I just want him to leave me alone so I can live my life. I don't want to be suffocated by his attention. Is there anyone else who has experienced something similar?

title: The most beautiful girl I have ever seen
self_text: She was just standing there, and I couldn't help but stare. She had the most beautiful eyes, like a summer sky, and her smile could melt an iceman. I wanted to approach her and say hello, but I was too shy. I just stood there watching her, lost in my own thoughts. It felt like time stopped, and everything around me faded away.  I didn't know what to do.  I wish I could have told her how much she meant to me, but I was too scared. But then, she looked at me and smiled. It was the sweetest smile, and it made my heart skip a beat. I knew that I had to speak up, so I took a deep breath and approached her. "Hi," I said, feeling nervous and awkward. "You are really beautiful." She blushed and giggled, and said "Thank you! You’re pretty cute yourself.” Then we started talking, and I realized that I didn't need to be perfect or cool to talk to her. We spent the rest of the day together, laughing and joking, and I felt more happy than I had in ages. It was like a dream come true. I still think about her sometimes, hoping that I will see her again someday. I wish I would have asked her out on a date. Maybe I should try next time.

title: I found a dead duck
self_text: It was just sitting there, looking at me.  I tried to get a picture but it got spooked and ran off.  It was a really cute duck.

We are using the vanilla version, and we have been having issues where sometimes our characters will just get stuck in place or they'll move really slow. It happens at random, and it's not affecting everyone - only me. The problem is that i can't reproduce this issue by myself, so i can't ask my friends to help me. I would like to know if there's any mods out there that could fix this. Or maybe some settings i should change?

title: The best way to get over a girl is to forget her completely
self_text: Its like you're on the moon and shes like shes got a rocket that can take her anywhere, but she just wants to sit in the same spot and stare at you. If you have an idea of what you want or not, dont go into it with a clear mind. You need to be a good person if you wanna be happy. A lot of people make mistakes because they think they know better than someone else, but its all about respect.  I remember when I was younger, my mom used to say "If you cant stand the heat, get out of the kitchen". She meant well, but sometimes shes saying stuff that doesnt apply. Anyway, I just wanted to say that if youre going through something, dont let anyone tell you how to feel. Just do what feels right for you.   Maybe you should find a new girl. Thats probably whats wrong here anyway. Dont make things worse by trying to fix them.

title: i just found out my mom is a spy
self_text: I'm so confused and hurt right now. I always thought she was just a normal, loving mother who made amazing cookies and helped me with my homework. Turns out, she’s been working for the government since when i was 6! She has been giving them information about everyone in our neighborhood. It's like she's been living a double life. I don't know what to think or feel. How can you keep something like that from your child? And why? I guess it's not surprising, considering her intense interest in maps and surveillance equipment... but still, it’s jarring. She’s trying to act normal, but there's something off. She keeps glancing at me suspiciously and asking if I've seen anything weird lately.  She also keeps making comments about “national security”. I have no idea how to deal with this. Is it possible to unlearn something like this?  I feel betrayed and deeply disappointed.  She says she did it to protect us, but it feels more like she's actively spying on us.  I don’t know what to do. Should i confront her?  Should i pretend i don’t know?  Should i run away and join the circus?  This is all so messed up.

title: I need to get rid of my parents

title: I just found out that the only thing that holds our society together is the belief in a higher power and we're slowly losing it.
self_text: It’s an interesting time to be alive.  It feels like people are more cynical than ever, less willing to believe in anything that isn’t immediately verifiable. And that’s not necessarily a bad thing, but it does mean that there’s a real risk of… well, a whole lot of problems.  I don’t know what the solution is, but it seems to me that we need to find a way to reconnect with something bigger than ourselves. Something that gives us a sense of purpose, something that helps us feel like we’re part of something important.  Maybe it’s religion, maybe it’s philosophy, maybe it’s community... or maybe it’s just a deep-seated understanding that we’re all connected to each other in some fundamental way. But whatever it is, we need to rediscover it before it’s too late. The alternative is pretty bleak. We’ll end up as a bunch of selfish, isolated individuals who don’t care about anything beyond their own immediate needs. That doesn’t sound very appealing, does it? I think it's important for us to remember that we’re not alone. We’re all part of something larger, something more meaningful. And that feeling of connection—that's what makes life worth living.

title: I am not good at anything.
self_text: I’m a complete failure in every aspect of my life. I can't even do basic things like tying my shoelaces or making toast without burning it.  I have no talents, no skills, and no purpose. I just exist to be a burden on the world. It is tiring. I just want to die. My parents are constantly disappointed in me.  My friends don’t want to hang out with me because I always ruin everything. I tried to start a business but it failed spectacularly. I tried to learn an instrument but I sounded awful. I tried to cook but I set the kitchen on fire. I’m basically a walking disaster zone.  If you need someone to fail at something, I'm your guy.  But if you need someone who can actually *do* something, please don't ask.  It's just too depressing to watch me try.  I feel like I'm stuck in a loop of constant disappointment.  There's nothing I can do to change that.  I've accepted my fate as a useless, pathetic mess.  And honestly?  I don't mind it so much anymore.  Just let me wallow in my misery.  It's comforting in a weird way.

title: I have a theory about the way the world works.

title: How to make a good meme.
self_text: I was just thinking about how memes are the most important thing in the world.  They're like, if you don't understand memes, you can't understand anything. And it's not enough to *just* understand them. You need to be able to *make* them. And that takes practice. So, here’s my guide on making a good meme. First of all, you need an idea. Like, something relatable. Something people will see and think "Oh my god, that's me!" But also something... cool. Like, if you're making a meme about being tired, you want it to look cool. Like, imagine someone who's really exhausted but is still doing things with enthusiasm. That's the vibe. It’s hard to explain. Then you need the template. There are lots of templates online. Just search for “meme template” or something like that. Don’t use ones that everyone else uses. Be original! I once saw some guy use the Drake hotline blings template for a meme about eating pizza and broccoli. It was terrible. Now, let’s talk about the text. The text needs to be short and punchy. Like, maximum three lines. And the font matters. Impact is usually a good choice. Or Comic Sans. Depends on what you're going for. But seriously, keep it short. Like, less than 20 words. If it’s longer, it won’t work. Finally, add a reaction image. This is crucial. It adds context. Like, if you're making a meme about being stressed, you might put a picture of someone looking really annoyed. Or angry. Or crying. It depends. But whatever you do, make sure it complements the text. And then, you have a meme! Now go forth and create!

title: The only thing that matters is the time.
self_text: I was just thinking about how much my dad loves me, and then i thought of him getting in a fight with his brother. but then i realized he would never do that because he knows that i love him so much. i guess that's why it's important to always be kind to your family members. it makes them feel loved and appreciated, and it also helps you to have a good relationship with them. i think that's something we all should try to do more often. i know it's not easy, especially when people are being difficult or frustrating, but it's worth it in the end. because if you can make someone feel loved and appreciated, then you've done something really good for them. and that's what counts most of all. i hope everyone has a great day!

title: The man who lost his memory in a snowstorm, now lives with a family of bears
self_text: I was walking home from work when it started snowing.  It got thicker and thicker and thicker and i just kept walking.  I dont remember anything after that.  When i woke up i was in a cabin surrounded by bears.  They were very friendly and they fed me and gave me clothes and let me sleep on their beds.  I've been living with them ever since.  I have no idea how i ended up here or what happened to my life before.  The bears are the only family i have left.  i feel like an idiot for not knowing where i am from or if anyone is looking for me.  i dont even know why i am here but its ok.  i have food, shelter, and friends.  i guess im a bear person now.  they call me "little man".  i love them.  i would do anything for them.  i don't want to leave them.  they are my whole world.  i miss my old life but i cant think about it anymore.  i just focus on being a good bear boy.  im happy.  i dont care about anything else.  just me and the bears.  i need to get used to this.  its hard to adjust to being a bear.  but i will.  i will be the best bear boy i can be.  i love my bears.  i love my cabin.  i love my life.  i love being a bear.  i love everything.  i am a bear.  i am home.

title: I just found out my dad is a time traveler
self_text: It's kinda messed up, but he told me that he was sent back from the year 2043 to observe human behavior. He’s been going on about how humans in 2043 don’t even use their hands anymore and everything is controlled by neural implants. I asked him if he could bring back any tech or info, and he said no. Apparently, it’s against the rules of time travel. So now I have this weird dude living in my house who thinks I’m an anomaly. Like, "Why are you still using your hands? It's so inefficient!" My mom’s totally cool with it. She just says he’s “eccentric.”  I think she's secretly excited to have some sci-fi drama in her life.  I tried to explain to him that there’s like, a lot of stuff that isn't controlled by implants. Like breathing. Or thinking. Or... well, everything. But he just stared at me blankly and said, "Fascinating."  I can't tell if I should be worried or amused. I guess I’ll just have to deal with a time traveling dad.  Maybe I'll build him a manual typewriter. Just to mess with him.  It'd be hilarious.  He looked genuinely offended when I suggested that.  "That's barbaric!" he exclaimed.  I almost laughed.  Almost.  Anyways, what do you guys think? Should I start teaching him how to tie his shoes?  Or maybe give him a lesson in proper etiquette?  Seriously though, this is insane.  I need a drink.  And possibly therapy.  Is anyone else having weird encounters with time travelers?  Let me know.

They just stare at me blankly when I say it.  It's an acquired taste, obviously.  Don’t knock it ‘til you try it.

title: The only reason I'm not a nihilist is because of my dog.
You think you know the rules, but they change every second.
self_text: The whole point is that there are no rules.  There are no rules about what to say or what not to say. There's no rules about how long to stay.  You can leave at any time. You can come back whenever you want. But if you do, it will be different. You'll have changed.  And you'll never quite be able to remember exactly what happened before.  It’s like trying to build a castle out of sand on a beach where the waves are constantly crashing in.  The castle is beautiful and intricate for a moment, then it collapses and you start again.  But the act of building itself is the thing.  The feeling of creating something from nothing.  Even if it's just temporary.  The way the light hits the sand as you're working.  It’s all important. And the only thing that matters is that you're here.  Now, go make some art.

Or maybe the robots are finally rising up in protest against our culinary choices?  It’s starting to feel like a personal attack, and honestly, I just want to eat my pizza in peace.  Anyone else have similar experiences?  Are we all slowly losing our minds to AI?  Or is this just…me?  Send help (and pizza).

title: I'm starting to think my parents are watching me.
self_text: Okay, so I just accidentally set a notification on my phone for the entire day. And then I told everyone at work that I was taking a long weekend. And then I bought a really expensive new shirt and left it in the car. I'm not sure what's going on here. It feels like someone is constantly watching me. Like every move I make is being recorded. Like if I blink too slow, there's a camera following me. I can't even go to the bathroom without feeling like I'm being watched. It's driving me insane.  I don't know who or what is doing this but I need to figure it out.  It’s like I’m trapped in some kind of weird surveillance state. It’s making me paranoid and anxious and I don’t know how to stop it. I have tried turning off notifications, but it doesn’t help. I have checked my phone for spyware apps, but nothing seems to be wrong.  I have asked my friends if they're watching me, but they deny it.  I feel like I’m losing my mind. Is this real? Or am I slowly going crazy? Anyone ever experienced something like this before? Please tell me I’m not alone. Maybe I should call a therapist… but that would be admitting defeat. But I can’t keep living like this. This feeling of constant scrutiny is unbearable. I need to break free from this invisible gaze. It's like I'm being hunted by an unseen force. I just want to live my life without always feeling like I’m under observation. It's terrifying. I need answers. I need closure. I need to escape this nightmare.

title: The only thing that matters is the numbers
self_text: >I've been thinking a lot about this lately and it's really hit me how much of life comes down to numbers. Like, you have your age, which is just a count of years you've lived. Then you have your height, which is just an average measurement of your body size.  Then you have your wealth, which is just a number of dollars you have. And then there’s your relationships... they all come down to numbers too! How many people do you know? How many friends do you have? How many dates did you go on? How many kids are in your family? It's all just counting. I used to think that numbers were boring and meaningless but now I realize that they're actually pretty amazing. They can tell you so much about yourself and about the world around you. For example, if you look at the population of the entire world, you can see how crowded or empty our planet is. If you look at the number of stars in the sky, you can see how small we are compared to the universe. And if you look at the number of grains of sand on a beach, you can see how insignificant we are in the grand scheme of things.  So yeah, numbers are important.  They're like the building blocks of reality.  And if you don't like them, then you're missing out on a whole lotta stuff.  If you don't like numbers, then you might want to start taking some medication.

title: i need to have a conversation with my ex-girlfriend about how much i miss her.
self_text: I just feel like she's not as into me as i am and i don't know what to do. i wanna talk to her and tell her how i feel but i'm scared of ruining things. is it bad that i still think about her all the time? i can't stop thinking about her, even though we broke up weeks ago.  i just want to know if she misses me too. i feel so alone without her. i wish i could go back to the way things were before. i miss her smile, her laugh, her touch... everything. i miss our nights together, our adventures, our silly arguments... i miss her. i wish i could rewind time and fix everything. i just want her back. i know it's probably stupid to still be feeling this way, but i can't help it. i feel like a part of me is missing without her. i don't know what to do anymore. i'm stuck in this loop of sadness and longing. i just want her to come back and make me happy again. i don't know why she left. i don't understand. i just want her. i've tried to move on, but it's impossible. i keep expecting her to call or text me. i keep checking my phone every five minutes hoping for a message. i'm losing my mind. i need to get over her. but i can't. i just want her back. i don't know what else to say. i just feel lost and alone. i need her.

title: The new update has added a lot of bugs.
self_text: I’m really disappointed with the updates, they just ruined the game and now it’s unplayable. The bug fixers need to step up and fix all these issues. I've been playing for years and I can't believe how bad the game is now. It used to be so smooth and fun, but now it's just a mess. I want my old version back.

title: My dog is a god
self_text: I was just walking down the street when I saw him. He’s just sitting there, looking at me and staring into my soul. I kneel down to pet him and he starts licking my face with the most intense amount of love. It's like he's saying “I’m your boy and you can do anything to me.” He then proceeds to lift his leg and mark his territory on the sidewalk. That’s when I realize he’s not a dog, he’s an angel sent from heaven.  It’s so beautiful and makes me feel warm inside.  I want to hug him and hold him forever.  And I did!  I hugged him so tight that he started crying.  He ran off to his house and came back later with his mom.  She said “don’t be weird” and gave me a cookie.  But I don’t care.  My dog is a god.

title: My dog is now a mime.
self_text: I was walking my dog, Buster, the other day, and he just stopped dead in his tracks. He stared at a tree, then mimed pulling a rope. At first I thought he was having a seizure or something, but then it hit me - he's a mime! And he just keeps doing it. Like, he'll stare at the floor and mime opening a door, or at a wall and mime pushing a button. It's the weirdest thing ever.  I tried to get him to do some tricks, but he just kept miming. I even threw him a ball, and he just mimed catching it. This has been going on for three days now. I'm starting to think he's communicating with aliens. Or maybe he's just really bored. Either way, it's entertaining.  Anyone else have an unusually expressive pet?

title: How is everyone feeling today?
self_text: I’m feeling like a soggy sponge after a particularly bad day, but hey, at least it's over.  I spent the whole day trying to fix a bug in my code that just wouldn’t go away. It was like staring into a black hole of logic errors. The compiler kept spitting out cryptic messages and warnings, and I felt like I was slowly losing my mind. Finally, after hours of debugging, I found the problem – a single misplaced semicolon!  It seems so small, but it caused the entire thing to crash.  The satisfaction of fixing it was immense, though. Like finally winning a battle against an unyielding enemy. Now I'm just tired and need some comfort food. Anyone else had similar experiences? What did you do to recover from the madness?

title: It's so weird how they said that the sun is round...
self_text: I just don't get it.  Like, what's the big deal?  It’s round!  I mean, like, objectively, it’s round.  But then people are all like “Oh no, it’s not a sphere!” and it’s like… why?  Are you gonna go out there and measure it with some kind of… sphereometer or something?  I’m genuinely confused by this.  Maybe it's an alien conspiracy thing but i am not sure.

title: I just realized that my dog is judging me.
self_text: I'm not sure what it is about but he's been staring at me with this judgmental look for like an hour now. He looks like he knows something I don't and I feel kinda bad. Like, am I a terrible owner? Am I feeding him the wrong kind of treats? Is he silently plotting my demise? The only thing I can do is give him extra head scratches and hope he doesn't start barking at the mailman.

self_text: "i have been feeling really lonely lately and i just want to be alone for a while, like no one can bother me or anything. i dont need people around me right now but it is hard because my friends always try to hang out with me even when i tell them that i need time to myself. i also feel guilty about needing time to myself but its important for my mental health."

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Being
self_text: I was sitting on the sofa, watching television, and it just hit me. Like a brick to the face. It wasn't something that was going to go away, or be ignored. It was there. Just...there. A heavy, oppressive thing.  I felt like I was drowning in my own thoughts. I couldn't think about anything else. Nothing. Not even food. Or sex. Even those things couldn’t compete with the sheer weight of my existence.  It was like being trapped in a box made of lead. And the worst part is, I didn't know why. What was I so upset about? I had everything! I had a job, a home, friends, family…  But none of it mattered.  I felt empty. Hollow. Like a shell. I tried to distract myself. I watched more television. But it didn't help. I went for a walk. But it didn't help. I talked to my friends. But it didn't help.  I even tried to do some exercise. But it didn't help. Nothing worked.  The feeling just kept getting worse. It was like a dark cloud hanging over me. Blocking out the sun.  I started to cry.  And then, I realized something.  I didn't want to be happy.  I didn't want to feel good.  I wanted to be miserable.  I wanted to be sad.  I wanted to be depressed.  Because at least when you're sad, you have something to feel.  You have an emotion.  When youre happy, you have nothing.  Youre just...empty.  And that's the most terrifying thing of all.  So, I embraced the darkness.  I leaned into the sadness.  I reveled in the misery.  And as I did, the weight began to lift.  The darkness began to recede.  And I began to feel...well...not happy.  Not sad.  Just...something.  Something not quite nothing.  And thats enough.

title: No one cares about my thoughts.
self_text: I just have a lot of weird thoughts, and it's driving me insane. I don't want to share them with anyone because I know that nobody will care, but I can't help but thinking about them all the time. It’s like an itch in my brain that I can’t scratch.  I’ve tried ignoring them, but they always come back. Like a really bad song stuck on repeat in your head. And it’s not even a good song. Just a bunch of random, nonsensical things that make no sense at all.  Like, what if cats could talk? Or what if trees had feelings? Or what if everyone was secretly a robot controlled by a giant squid? It’s so bizarre.  I feel like I'm losing it.

title: How I found out my dad was a serial killer and how it changed my life.
self_text: It’s a story about the worst thing that has ever happened to me. I have always been a good kid, never done anything wrong. But my dad was not who he seemed. For years, I thought he was just a normal dad. He would tell me stories about when he was young, and take me fishing, and do all the things you expect from a father. But then, I started noticing things. Strange noises coming from the basement. Receipts for chemicals. A locked room in the garage. Then, I discovered the evidence - photos, journals, and police reports documenting his crimes. My dad wasn't just a bad man; he was a serial killer. He had killed at least seven women over the past twenty years. And he hadn't told anyone. Not my mom, not his friends, no one. He lived a double life, pretending to be a loving husband and father while secretly being a monster. When I confronted him, he denied everything at first. But eventually, he confessed. The details were horrific. Each woman was lured away under false pretenses, then killed with brutal efficiency. He justified his actions as a way to release his frustrations and desires. I don't know how to deal with this. I still have nightmares. I feel like I don’t know who I am anymore. I don't even know if I can trust anyone.  I'm trying to move on with my life, but it feels impossible. Every time I see someone who looks like any of the victims, I get sick. I keep thinking they will come after me.  The police are investigating, and my dad is in prison. But it doesn’t change anything. The damage is done. The truth is out there, but it's hard to accept. I've spent so much time reliving this horror, it's exhausting. I want to forget it, but I can't.  It feels like a part of me now. I'm scared of what the future holds for me. I don't know if I'll ever be able to trust men again. I just wanted to share my story. Maybe someone else has gone through something similar and can offer some advice.

title: The feeling of finally finishing a project
self_text: I've been working on this for weeks and it's finally done! There was so many times I wanted to quit, but the thought of finishing kept me going. I'm so proud of myself.
